Class.comment: A topic for a topic-based publish/subscribe system. It can be used to access a stream of events.

owl:Class.comment: Something that happens or is contemplated as happening.
An unbounded, ordered set of events of the same type, from the same source.

Event.rdfs:comment: This is a dummy individual (an event instance) used as placeholder before a final, unique event ID is known e.g. while assembling CONTRUCT query results internally to DCEP.

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: A derived event usually has an event pattern which is responsible for creating it.
An event can have a location, being a point.
owl:FunctionalProperty.label: location

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: An event can have member events if the event is complex and the participating events should be made explicit.
An event usually has one source.
An event usually belongs to a stream.

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: A boolean field stating whether the ack is positive or negative.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoAckResult

owl:ObjectProperty.comment: Identifying actions to be performed when the recommendation is accepted. In a single event we could have several actions, all referring to the same human readable message, also included in the event.
owl:ObjectProperty.label: ucTelcoAction

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: A boolean field 'Ack with answer required' (the user has to send an Ack saying he followed the recom or not).
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoAnswerRequired

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: String composed of numerical chars only.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoCalleePhoneNumber

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: String composed of numerical chars only.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoCallerPhoneNumber

owl:DatatypeProperty.dc:desciption: Specifies whether the (missed) call was incoming or outgoing: 'incoming' or 'outgoing'.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoDirection

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: String, composed of numerical chars only. The length is variable. Example: 33000000000
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoPhoneNumber

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: Set of actions (HTTP URI) in the recommendation which generated the ack. (Optional, 0:n)
owl:FunctionalProperty.label: ucTelcoRelAction

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: The URL identifying the RecomEvent which generated the ack.
owl:FunctionalProperty.label: ucTelcoRelRecommendation

owl:DatatypeProperty.comment: The uniqueId of the RecomEvent which generated the ack.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoRelUniqueId

owl:DatatypeProperty.dc:desciption: Specifies what type of user created this event: 'Customer' or 'Driver'.
owl:DatatypeProperty.label: ucTelcoUserType

owl:Class.comment: Action to be recommended by ESR.
owl:Class.label: EsrAction

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: A link with a unique identifier for each recommendation.
owl:FunctionalProperty.label: esrRecommendation

owl:Class.label: Manage an event pattern in MCEP.

owl:FunctionalProperty.comment: A small icon (favicon) describing stream instances, event classes, event instances, etc.
owl:FunctionalProperty.label: Icon

Class.comment:
Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.
spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT), lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).
sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).
A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84.
Class.label: point

Class.comment: Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position. e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.
Class.label: SpatialThing

rdf:Property.comment: The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters above the local reference ellipsoid).
rdf:Property.label: geoAltitude

rdf:Property.comment: The WGS84 latitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
rdf:Property.label: geoLatitude

rdf:Property.comment: The relation between something and the point, or other geometrical thing in space, where it is. For example, the realtionship between a radio tower and a Point with a given lat and long. Or a relationship between a park and its outline as a closed arc of points, or a road and its location as a arc (a sequence of points). Clearly in practice there will be limit to the accuracy of any such statement, but one would expect an accuracy appropriate for the size of the object and uses such as mapping .
rdf:Property.label: geoLocation

rdf:Property.comment: The WGS84 longitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
rdf:Property.label: geoLongitude
